text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Mega-CD, or Sega CD in America, is a Megadrive / Genesis addon released in 1991. To compete with the PC Engine Duo it adds a CD-ROM drive, doubles the speed of the processor, adds 512 KB of RAM and 10 sound channels. Sega made the mistake of focusing too much on games in FMV (Full Motion Video) causing occasionally poor video rendering of 128 to 256 colors. Some are still excellent, like Road Avenger and Night Trap, or classic hits such as Sonic CD, Lords of Thunder, Silpheed and Final Fight CD.
